title: Neighbours spoilers: Toadie’s betrayal, and sex tape blackmail
text:
All the big Neighbours spoilers right here (Picture: Channel 5)

It’s a terrifying week in Neighbours with one Neighbour missing presumed dead, another leaving for good, and a third who seems to be prepared to kill to get what she wants.

Things aren’t any easier this week after Elly Conway (Jodi Anasta) had to wave goodbye to Mark Brennan (Scot McGregor) when he took off to care for his mum Fay. They’re about to get way worse – she and Finn Kelly (Rob Mills) are about to get some devastating news that could mean the death of a loved one.

It’s an explosive week for Scarlett (Christie Whelan Browne) as her stalker plans take a terrible turn, resulting in her blackmailing Paul Robinson (Stefan Dennis) and putting Ned Willis (Ben Hall) in great danger. Just how far is she prepared to go?

Gary Canning (Damien Richardson) is set to be scarred for life when his mum Sheila (Colette Mann) makes a huge error.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And Toadie (Ryan Moloney) risks being on the receiving end of Shane (Nicholas Coghlan) and Dipi’s (Sharon Johal) wrath when he goes behind their backs.

Here’s what’s coming up next week in Neighbours.

1. Sex tape blackmail

Paul senses something is up with Scarlett when he realises she hasn’t submitted real references for the job. And when he investigates further he uncovers more lies. He confronts her and tries to give her the sack, but she turns the tables on him – she knows all about the hidden cameras in Lassiters and unless he lets her keep the job that keeps her near Ned, she’ll be blabbing to the press to ruin him.

2. Shaun of the dead?

Has Elly got to say goodbye to Shaun too? (Picture: Channel 5)

Finn is excitedly planning for Shaun’s arrival back in Erinsborough, although he’s momentarily distracted by Bea accidentally calling him Patrick during a heated argument. They’re both shocked by her outburst and are fearful of what it means, but they’re interrupted when Finn receives a phone call. He learns that there has been an avalanche in Switzerland and Shaun is missing! He immediately fears the worst but he’s left angry at Elly who refuses to accept the likely truth. His frustration pushes her to breaking point and she reveals why she’s trying to be so positive – She’s terrified her baby has lost its dad.

3. Sheila’s sex pic shame

Roxy senses something is up with Sheila and when she presses her Sheila cracks and confesses, she and Clive are back together. Roxy is initially pleased until she realises that Clive hasn’t actually dumped Beverly yet. What is he playing at? She’s worried about Sheila and warns her to protect herself. She advises her to make sure she is the only woman on Clive’s mind and tells her the best way to do it is to use her feminine wiles, and sending him a saucy pic of herself. Sheila is thrilled with the idea and does as Roxy suggests, but is left feeling worried when Clive takes too long to reply. Then it slowly dawns on her what she’s done – she’s sent it to the wrong person! We’ve all been there. Sort of. Sheila picked the worst person in her contacts to send a nude – Her SON. Can Sheila stop him from seeing her sext before it scars him for life?

Advertisement

Advertisement

4. Scarlett’s plan takes a deadly turn

How far will Scarlett go to get Ned? (Picture: Channel 5)

After getting one up on Paul, Scarlett has renewed confidence in her game to ensnare Ned. She ups the ante, telling him she needs him to take her to the Tram where she thinks she left her mobile phone. It’s late at night so Ned agrees, totally unaware he’s walking into a trap. Just as they reach the Tram, suddenly out of the darkness a motorbike comes speeding right at them. Scarlett thought Ned would try and save her and leap out of the way, but she was wrong, he stands frozen. Will her plan see him badly injured.

5. Pierce breaks Hendrix’s heart

Pierce is preparing for the arrival of the Melbourne Cup and arranges a nice family photo with it along with his son, something Hendrix is looking forward to. But they’re both surprised when Chloe returns home early and it causes Pierce to forget about plans with his son. Hendrix reacts badly, Pierce just can’t see that all he wants is his attention. The teen acts out after being stood up and steals the cup, stashing it in Harlow and Roxy’s car and causing a frenzy as people go searching for it. It gets back to a frantic Pierce that Hendrix was behind the cup’s disappearance, and he loses it. He lashes out telling him he wishes he’d never come to Erinsborough. Has he ruined things with his son for good?

Advertisement

6. Toadie’s betrayal

Toadie goes behind Shauns back (Picture: Channel 5)

Toadie is amazed when Krishna sets him up with free accounting software that totally sorts out how he deals with business at the nursery, his law firm and the foundation. She confesses to her uncle that she often feels forgotten in her family, so Toadie encourages her to tell them. He backs her as she tells her parents she wants to go for an interstate scholarship. Naturally they’re not keen, they think she’s too anxious. Elly uses some powerful tools to persuade them, but they won’t change their minds. Impressed by his niece’s courage in facing her anxiety and in shooting for the stars, Toadie goes behind their backs to write Kirsha a recommendation. What will happen if she gets accepted?!

Scenes air from Monday 21st of October at 1.45pm and 5.30pm on Channel 5.

description: All the spoilers coming up in Neighbours right here.
